data.title: add quit label as the common quit process
data.body:
Now, a user can execute label "confirm_quit" before quits ren'py, but it's called only by the close button.
It's not called by the Quit action or the quit of config.game_menu or config.main_menu.
I added the special label "quit" which is called by all processes when quit ren'py if it exists.

Issue: if confirm_quit or _compat_confirm_quit exists, this label is not called  by the close button.
Should I leave them for compatibility?

data.title: Ren'Py for android doesn't detect vertical glyphs
data.body:
Ren'Py for Android shows horizontal glyphs in vert tags.

I think this behavior will be fixed if it uses patched freetype:
https://github.com/renpy/renpy-deps/blob/master/source/freetype-2.2.1-enable-valid.patch
but I couldn't find freetype.so in RAPT.
![device-2013-07-30-212840](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/2175479/878510/dcd4a75a-f914-11e2-920c-0dbef2747653.png)

data.title: Fix and unify autosave
data.body: I fixed bug about autosave and unified all checks about if in main menu or not into the force_autosave function.

data.title: don't take_screenshot menu
data.body:
Now, Ren'Py takes screenshot of the game menu when I open the game menu and click the close buttton.
So I fixed this problem.

data.title: can return to main menu from game menu by R-click
data.body:
Now, user can return to game from game menu by R-click, but can't return to main menu from game menu by R-click.
So I fixed it.

data.title: autosave in menu
data.body: I think that if a autosave is done in menu, .users can retry menus after time.

data.title: unified all autosave checks into one
data.body:
Sory, I added unnecessary many codes about improve_autosave.
So, I want to unify all checks.

data.title: Added __str__ to ADVCharacter class
data.body:
I found it quite terrible to have to directly write every name into dialogues. The only solution I found was to define a variable for every char which is simply unnecessary as most characters do have a definition.

I think it would be way easier to simply implement an `ADVCharacter.__str__` method. With this patch you could avoid multiple definitions of a character's name:

```
define c = Character('myChar', color="#c0c0c0")
c "Hello there. My name is %(c)s"
```

Additionally my emacs removed all hidden tabs and spaces for example if there were tabs and/or space in empty lines (sorry about that - but by doing this at least the file gets smaller in size, so I just left it this way). The `__str__` method is at line 731.

I'm not quite sure if this would be your way of handling this issue, but if you're fine with a `__str__` method to directly use your classes in dialogues you may accept this small patch. I think it's easier and more convenient to use a syntax like `%(c)s` in order to reduce redundancy.

data.body: I enables the fast skip to also stop in un_seen, if renpy.game.preferences.skip_unseen is False.

Now the Skip action is sensitive even if a user is in unseen and renpy.game.preferences.skip_unseen is false.
So I want to change it.

data.title: renpy.list_files doesn't work on android.
Add funcs to music room
data.body:
I want to add functions to MusicRoom.

```
def MusicRoom.RandomPlay(self)
```

This starts playing the file chosen from unlocked_list.
This is used to show RandomPlay button on MusicRoom.

```
def MusicRoom.TogglePlay(self)
```

This starts playing when the music room is playing.
Otherwise, stop the music.
And this is selected when the music room is playing.
This is used to show TogglePlay button on MusicRoom.

data.title: Improve autosave
data.body:
Now the autosave has three problems.

1:   It's not done when return to the main menu.
2:   It's not done if a prompt is not shown and done even if a user replies "No" to the prompt.
3:   It's also done even if in the main menu.

data.title: Dragged objects misbehaving at edge of screen
data.body:
I'm creating a draggroup containing draggable images in a new screen.
When these images are dragged near the bottom or right part of the screen, they start flashing rapidly, and their visible location moves to the opposite side of the screen.

I've heard that this did not happen in older versions of Renpy, so I'll presume it's a bug rather than just bad coding on my part.

Code: http://pastebin.com/HkGWygzQ

Distributable: https://docs.google.com/file/d/0B10nBXG6kLj1Z0pUSm9CNVppRFU/edit?usp=sharing

To replicate the bug, simply drag the image to the bottom or right of the screen.

What I was expecting is for the image to drag partially off the screen without flashing or teleporting.

data.title: add a variable set the minimum number of component in automatic_images
Problem with MultipleTransition
data.body:
I ran into some troubles using MultipleTransition. I'm a little wary of making this report, since it seems like a basic problem that might just be my mistake, but there might be a regression issue of some sort here.

I've included a copy of a script.rpy file that demonstrates the problem.

```
# You can place the script of your game in this file.

image red = "#f00"
image blue = "#00f"
image green = "#0f0"


# The game starts here.
label start:

    show red as thecolor with fade

    "Here is a red color we will transition to blue."

    $mtrans_1 = MultipleTransition(False,Dissolve(2.0),True)
    $mtrans_2 = MultipleTransition(False, fade, "green", dissolve, True)

    "Either one of these transitions will produce a different error message."

    #show blue as thecolor with mtrans_1
    #"The error is: __init__() got multiple values for keyword argument 'new_widget'"

    #show blue as thecolor with mtrans_2
    #"The error is: __init__() takes at most 4 arguments (8 given)"

    "..."


    return
```

data.title: Something is wrong with the ATL warper definition order
data.body:
I define a custom ATL warper in a python early block in a file called _ui_early.rpy in the game directory. This warper works in all ATL blocks in script labels directly in the game directory. However, it isn't found if the scripts are in a subfolder called "FR". But it works if I rename that folder to "zz_FR".

Clearly something to do with alphabetical load order, but it's not obvious to me how exactly since the script file still comes before both. In any case it's a weird problem since nothing else depends on script name and folder structure in this way.

data.title: "Exception: No available audio device" when trying to launch a project
data.body:
## Hi, I just downloaded the latest renpy for the first time and tried to launch on 64 bit arch linux (with alsa sound) The initial menu starts ok, but when i try to open 'the question' project i get 

Full traceback:
  File "/opt/renpy-6.15.4-sdk/renpy/bootstrap.py", line 254, in bootstrap
    renpy.main.main()
  File "/opt/renpy-6.15.4-sdk/renpy/main.py", line 313, in main
    renpy.display.core.Interface()
  File "/opt/renpy-6.15.4-sdk/renpy/display/core.py", line 1145, in **init**
    renpy.audio.audio.init()
  File "/opt/renpy-6.15.4-sdk/renpy/audio/audio.py", line 596, in init
    pss.init(renpy.config.sound_sample_rate, 2, bufsize, False)
  File "sound.pyx", line 164, in pysdlsound.sound.init (gen/pysdlsound.sound.c:2362)
  File "sound.pyx", line 64, in pysdlsound.sound.check_error (gen/pysdlsound.sound.c:604)
Exception: No available audio device

After initialization, but before game start.
## Exception: No available audio device

Obviously it is having trouble locating the audio device on my system, but i have no experience with pysdlsound, so I don't really know what exactly it is looking for. 
Here is my /proc/asound/pcm (just in case it helps at all) 
00-03: HDMI 0 : HDMI 0 : playback 1
01-00: ALC888 Analog : ALC888 Analog : playback 1 : capture 1
01-01: ALC888 Digital : ALC888 Digital : playback 1
01-02: ALC888 Analog : ALC888 Analog : capture 1

I will of course try to look into this myself, but If anyone can help that would be great. (e.g. Is it looking for a particular device like /dev/snd or something?)
thanks.

data.title: Ren'Py zip distributions contain world-writable files.
data.body:
And apparently info-zip overrides the user's umask.

http://lemmasoft.renai.us/forums/viewtopic.php?f=32&t=21529&view=unread#unread

data.title: Ren'py Javascript renderer
data.body:
Desktop applications can sometimes be a bit of a pain; particularly if you're trying to make something really low-effort to start playing around with, it makes much more sense to let your users do that in a browser, rather than having to download and launch a native app.

Ren'py is pretty freakin' awesome, though, and it'd be a shame to [reimplement it all](http://langintro.com/js-vine/).  So, I was wondering if anyone had tried making a Javascript output for Ren'py.

Are there fundamental reasons this wouldn't work?  Would it be feasible as part of the project, or would it have to be some sort of fork?  Am I just crazy for wanting this?

data.title: Flickering when dragging and dropping (fix included)
data.body:
If you drag an Drag displayable to the right or to the bottom of its DragGroup area, flickering occurs as you move the mouse, and if you hold the mouse still while dragging, at certain positions, the dragged object disappears.

The issue is that sometimes, the formula that determines where the right or bottom border is will return a float instead of an int.

You can fix this by changing these lines in renpy/display/dragdrop.py:

466: new_x = min(new_x, int(i.parent_width - i.w))
468: new_y = min(new_y, int(i.parent_height - i.h))

data.title: Some OS X keyboard shortcuts don't work in the launcher.
data.body: Some (all?) OS X keyboard shortcuts don't work in the launcher even though they do work in projects, notably cmd-m for minimize and especially cmd-q for quit. This is somewhat annoying and there doesn't seem to be a reason for it.
